abstract.p: Morris Baran letter, commenting on May 9 article, recalls German guard named Schmid or Schmidt who helped him and other slave laborers near Minsk in 1942

block.p: Your May 9 news article ''New Model for Soldiers in Germany: A Sergeant of 1941 Who Saved Jews,'' about the renaming of a base to honor Anton Schmid, brings to memory another Schmid or Schmidt, who was one of many German guards overseeing our group. We were slave laborers building a railroad link near Minsk in 1942.

Your May 9 news article ''New Model for Soldiers in Germany: A Sergeant of 1941 Who Saved Jews,'' about the renaming of a base to honor Anton Schmid, brings to memory another Schmid or Schmidt, who was one of many German guards overseeing our group. We were slave laborers building a railroad link near Minsk in 1942.
I was one of hundreds marched from the ghetto each day to the place of work. We were often beaten, harassed and harangued by the guards.
Schmidt was the exception. He used every occasion he had to help us obtain food and showed understanding for our plight, a phenomenon so rare in those days.
